definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Covered with gold and diamonds, these are true works of art.
sentences.chinese: 这些镶金带钻的手表是真正的艺术品。

sentences.english: Frieda's engagement ring is a diamond set in gold.
sentences.chinese: 费丽达的定婚戒指是镶金钻戒。

sentences.english: A goblin stands guard here, dressed in a uniform of scarlet and gold.
sentences.chinese: 一个穿着一身猩红镶金制服的妖精站在这里守卫。

definition: variant of 鎦金|镏金[liu2 jin1]
to gild/(old) wages paid to a performer or a troupe by a theater
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
Baiyü county (Tibetan: dpal yul rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
to gold-plate/to gild/(fig.) to make sth quite ordinary seem special
